abstract.text: Initiate install validation by displaying a StoreKit-rendered ad with signed parameters.

metadata.title: Generating the signature to validate StoreKit-rendered ads

inlineContent.text: Install validation informs an ad network when users install and launch an app they purchase after viewing an ad. Ad networks first provide an ad with cryptographically signed information that includes their ad network ID. Later, if the ad results in a conversion, the customer’s device sends install-validation postbacks. For information about attribution-winning and nonwinning postbacks, see
These instructions are for signing StoreKit-rendered ads. If you’re presenting a view-through ad, see
To display a StoreKit-rendered ad and initiate a validation, an app needs to call
with a signature key that the ad network generates,
. To generate the signature, combine the required values from
and cryptographically sign the resulting string. Use the ad network ID and PKCS#8 private key that you establish when registering to use the API. For more information, see

content.text: Choose parameters based on signature version

inlineContent.text: Select the required values of

based on the version of the signature you’re generating. The API supports multiple versions of signed ads. Use the most recent version available in the SDK whenever possible. For information about availability, see
The following table lists the required signature parameters for version 4 and later. Combine them in a UTF-8 string as the example shows in the
section below.
Signature parameter
Equivalent key
This value replaces
from previous versions.
Lowercase the string representation of the nonce value in the signature.
During testing, use an ID of
if you’re using a development-signed build and not an app from the App Store.
Version 2.2 and later signatures require this parameter.
Set
to
for StoreKit-rendered ads.
To create signatures for previous SKAdNetwork versions, see:
If you build your app with iOS SDK 11.3 through 13.7, see
Create the UTF-8 string using the parameters in the example below.
Lowercase the string representation of the nonce:
. Failing to do so results in an invalid signature. Only ads with valid signatures can get ad attributions.
For version 4 and later, combine the values into a UTF-8 string with an invisible separator (
) between them, in the exact order the code below shows:

code: // Parameter values combined, in order, for version 4 and later.
version + '\u2063' + ad-network-id + '\u2063' + source-identifier + '\u2063' + itunes-item-id + '\u2063' + nonce + '\u2063' + source-app-id + '\u2063' + fidelity-type + '\u2063' + timestamp

inlineContent.text: Sign the combined UTF-8 string with the following key and algorithm:
Your PKCS#8 private key.
The Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) with a SHA-256 hash.
The resulting Digital Encoding Rules (DER)-formatted binary value is the signature.
Encode the binary signature you generate into a Base64 string. The result is your ad network attribution signature,
. The signature string should look similar to the following:
For more information about Base64 encoding, see
After you generate the signature, you have all the required
an app needs to call
to intiate a validation.
If the user installs and launches the advertised app, the attribution-winning ad network receives an install-validation postback. For more information about postbacks, see

abstract.text: Returns a Base-64 encoded string.
Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
A class that validates advertisement-driven app installations.
The key that represents the advertising network’s cryptographic signature to use for install validation.
The key that represents the advertising network’s campaign.
The key that represents the advertising network’s unique identifier.
The key that represents a random value to use for added security.
The key that represents the App Store ID of the app that displays the ad.
A four-digit integer that ad networks define to represent the ad campaign.
The key that represents the UNIX time, in milliseconds, of the ad impression.
The key that represents the version of the ad network API.
The key representing the iTunes identifier for the item you want the store to display when the view controller is presented.
Loads a new product screen to display.
Validate advertisement-driven app installations.
Specify key values that validate and associate an app installation with an ad campaign.
Generate signatures for apps compiled with earlier SDKs.

abstract.text: Learn about timeframes and priorities for ad impressions that result in ad attributions, and how additional impressions qualify for postbacks.
Use the install-validation APIs for your ad campaigns after registering your ad network with Apple.
Learn about the features in each SKAdNetwork version.
Ensure the validity of a postback you receive after an ad conversion by verifying its cryptographic signature.
